How difficult was it to communicate with your partner?

Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: collaborative

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
SI
nice! i'm at the start next to this twig
where should i go?
I think you can pass behind the snake to the other side.
hmm, i see
to reach the snake though, i need to pass the giraffe. what path should i take starting from the twig?
Use the frog path
alright, gotcha! i'm passing the tiger, butterfly, and heading to the parrot
is that okay?
Okay, but becareful the tiger does not catch you
haha, i'll try to be quick! i see the frog now
should i continue to the crocodile or go somewhere else?
Can you swim behind the crocodile?
sure can! i'm now behind the crocodile, should i head towards the elephant?
No just grab the gold box
okay, got it! i'm just a few steps from the treasure
eureka!!! *finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Yes, lets go
awesome sauce! now, let's start off with a little stroll to the left, towards that wooden bench
go ahead and cross the trail towards the florist stand, but let's trick it! do a u-turn before reaching it and head back to our white furball friend
okay
super! now, aim for the other white dog chilling next to the red and white picnic mat
he's south from here, just over the branch. got it?
The white dog with the black or brown ear?
yes mate, that's exactly the one! let's keep that southward trend going, okay? just step over the mat and get a whiff of those berries
okay, got it
perfect! now, continue going towards the west
you see that wooden branch that crosses the river? let's use it as a bridge, but this time, we're going north
okay
alright! once you cross, be sure not to touch the green bush
instead, go around it from the right until you reach the florist stand
okay I see it
sweet! now, turn left, pass under the stand, and head towards that awesome bridge with the cyclists
keep going west
Okay
right, after the bridge, there's a bench with two old folks catching up on their newspapers
notice 'em?
Yes I see them
perfect! now, guide yourself south
the path is right between the cool oldies and a wooden branch. keep going until you hit a green bush at the end of the branch
Should I cross the river?
nah buddy, stay on this side of the river
just move yourself a bit to the east, between the branch and the bush
Okay
great job! now keep on walking to the east a few steps more
Walking
look for a young deer in shades of brown
it's waiting for you to arrive, ok?
I see the deer
great job

chat.msg: hey there, estas listo?
Yes
alright, starting from the north
i'm at the tent. should i head towards the dog by the fire or another direction?
head towards the dog
cool, just passed by the dog, the mushroom's on my right
straight ahead toward the car or do i need to turn?
don't take the road that leads to the car
i see, should i head towards the telescope instead?
yes
alright, made it to the telescope
rocks are on my left. straight to the house or another way?
straight to the house. But can you jump the rocks?
can do, just jumped over the rocks, and voila! at the house
*finished*

chat.msg: hey, estas listo?
yes
great! start by going under the first palm tree towards the southwest, then hang a right and whizz past the second palm tree
before you hit the third tree, take a quick left and head south. you got that?
towards the dog?
yes, that's right
just veer slightly to the left of the adorable puppy. after that, swerve right to keep going south, cool?
cool
alright, next see those two rocks? the big one on your left and the small one on your right? head straight between them till you reach the sea
in the sea now
nice! now, do you see that large red crab? neat, huh? now make a right turn towards the big rock and keep going west in the water
you're doing great!
okay then what
keep going until you spot a medium-sized rock in the water and what looks like a shark! don't panic- take a sharp right turn at this point
got it?
passed the shark
perfect! now head back to the land
you'll cross between the medium rock and an eye-catching, colorful ball. keep movin' towards the north
seen the ball
good job! now just nudge a bit towards the north-west, between a flaming red tent and an oversized speaker on your right
not the usual sight, huh?
there now
awesome! now circle the tent like you're playing tag and then head south until you see the sea again
make sure you won't touch the water though!
okay
great! just as you approach the shore, make a right and go underneath a red kayak
there now
perfect! make a 90-degree turn to the right, walk alongside the kayak until you reach a tiny little green bush
this is where we end! how'd you do?
we did great
awesome! you were fantastic at following directions
high five! can't wait for our next adventurous map game

general_survey.answer: My grandparents used to speak it when they visit or I visit them.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: They do so when they wan to use the right word.
